children.text: There have not been any noggings or trimmers installed between the wall studs over the top and/or sides of the bath to pick up and support the edges of the plaster sheets.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 2589 Gypsum Linings - Application and Finishing states in clause 4.4.3.1.3 Perimeter Fixing that
‘Fasteners shall be installed at 300 mm maximum centres at all internal angles, external corners and at openings for perimeter fastening’ .
Given the spacing of the existing studs, noggings will need to be installed so that the edges of the plaster sheets can be securely fixed to the wall framing at their required centres.
